alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:51AM CDT until March 30 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the Meramec River in Missouri... near Steelville near Eureka at Pacific at Valley Park at Fenton at Arnold. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River at Pacific. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Jefferson Street extension is flooded and closed. Dogpound at the east end of East Congress Street begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 22.1 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Meramec River Pacific 15.0 7.1 12.1 17.9 21.9 19.8 12.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
